text: The Yonne is a river in the northern half of France. It flows mainly through the western part of the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region, giving its name to the Yonne department and to several communes. It is the main left tributary of the Seine river. The river was named during the Roman Empire as Icauna, a Latin word that likely came from the Celtic name for the river. ==Geography== The Yonne river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is 91.70 cubic metres per second at Courlon-sur-Yonne. The Yonne flows, in general, from the southeast to the northwest and passes through the 115 communes, most of them in the Bourgogne-Franche- Comté region; the main communes are: * Nièvre (58): Corbigny, Clamecy * Yonne (89): Auxerre, Joigny, Sens, Pont-sur-Yonne, Villeneuve-sur-Yonne * Seine-et- Marne (77): Montereau-Fault-Yonne Finally, it flows, as a left tributary, into the Seine river in the town of Montereau-Fault-Yonne, at of altitude. ==Main tributaries== The main tributaries of the Yonne are: * Left tributary ** Beuvron - 40.5 km; * Right tributaries ** Cure - 112.2 km; ** Serein - 188.2 km; ** Armançon - 202.1 km; ** Vanne - 58.7 km; ==Gallery== File:Auxerre - Vue de l'Yonne 4.jpg|View of Auxerre and the Yonne File:Léglise Saint-Maurice et lYonne à Sens (2637691088).jpg|Sens on the Yonne river File:Saint-Aubin- sur-Yonne-FR-89-A-04.JPG|Saint-Aubin-sur-Yonne and a bridge on the Yonne river File:FR-58-Clamecy13.JPG|Clamecy and the Yonne river File:Yonne Seine w.jpg|Confluence at Montereau-Fault-Yonne, the Seine to the left and the Yonne to the right. ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station H2721010 - L'Yonne à Courlon-sur- Yonne (Synthèse) Category:Rivers of Bourgogne-Franche-Comté Category:Rivers of Île-de-France
